page.title: 01Uyeasound Eastside.
page.content: The Eastside of Uyeasound has the most of Uyeasound's population and contains the largest and newest Council Housing Development at Brucehall Terrace.This development contains both family and sheltered housing.There are also old and new private houses. Uyeasound Kirk and Muness Castle are all to be found in this side of the village.In addition there are many deserted croft houses and ancient remains such as standing stones, depicting the modern and ancient history of the village. The Eastside has a picturesque coastline showing variety from cliffs and geos to sandy beaches.The seabird population is interesting and varied. The area is peaceful but wind and rain are too frequent.There are many sheep but ponies and cattle are also kept and some oats,barley and roots grown.
